subject: Career
title: Competing Offers as Leverage
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Competing Offers as Leverage.

hook.text: Nothing increases your value faster than another company wanting you too.

buildup.text: A competing offer proves your market value isn't theoretical â€” someone else validated it.

discovery.text: You don't need to bluff. 'I have another offer at $X and want to make an informed decision' is enough.

twist.text: Fabricating an offer is risky. Recruiters talk. Getting caught destroys trust permanently.

climax.text: Even if you prefer Company A, Company B's offer gives you leverage to improve A's package.

punchline.text: The best negotiation position: you want them and they know others want you.

quiz.question: Why are competing offers effective in negotiation?
options: They prove your market value is validated by others
